description:
Recipients of basic security benefits in old age and in
cases of reduced earning capacity

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
22151 Basic security in old age, reduced earning capacity

Definition:
People who have reached the age limit described in Section
41 (2) of the Social Code, Book XII, and who receive basic
security benefits in old age as well as people aged from 18
to under the age limit who are permanently unfit for work
and receive basic security benefits because of their reduced
earning capacity.
